5.text: It think real confidence is about knowing yourself being true to that and really knowing your true worth

13.text:
I think that shines through and you can tell
when that's authentic, that's real confidence

18.text:
I remember the first TV job I ever had, I
turned up on set and I had learnt the lines

27.text:
and I just panicked and I thought that's it,
I'm going to be fired

30.text:
I then we walked onto set and I was feverishly trying
to learn my lines

36.text:
and the lead actor walked on and said 'I'm
terribly ill, I'm going to have to call off

43.text:
I was like 'Great, yes, oh yes, you should
go home and sleep, bye bye'

48.text:
It was such a relief and I really leant my
lesson that day

52.text:
learn everything way in advance, never
leave it until the last minute!

57.text:
to be honest I think it's important to keep
a sense of humour about most things,

64.text:
If I'm in a situation where I don't know what
to do, I'll often think of someone who inspires me

70.text:
and I ask myself 'what would Dame Helen
Mirren do?'

74.text:
We need to talk about equality and we need
to stop thinking of men and women as people

80.text: who are competing in different arena's

81.text:
I also think we need to stop perpetuating
this idea that women are in major competition with each other

87.text:
I for myself have a wonderful tribe women
and men around men

91.text:
and we really celebrate each others successes, I
think there's room for everybody at the top

98.text:
I would say if I had a beauty secret it would
be to laugh a lot, sleep a lot

105.text: and to  not be too hard on yourself.
